subject: Technology
title: Short-Form Video: TV in Your Pocket
description: A short lesson to help you apply Short-Form Video: TV in Your Pocket.

hook.text: A generation that grew up on 60-second TikToks now finds 30-minute sitcoms too long. Television is shrinking.

buildup.text: YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, and TikTok deliver entertainment in seconds. No commitment, no waiting, instant gratification.

discovery.text: Short-form video reaches more people than traditional TV. A viral TikTok gets more views than most cable shows.

twist.text: Traditional studios now create short-form content for social platforms. The line between TV and social media is dissolving.

climax.text: Attention spans are adapting to shorter content. The future of video might not look like television at all.

punchline.text: TV went from three channels to infinite clips. Each one shorter than the last.

quiz.question: How is short-form video affecting traditional television?
options: It has no effect on TV
It's training audiences to expect shorter content, pressuring traditional formats
